meanings.definition: To alter or change something again
meanings.sent1: I had to realter my essay after getting feedback from my teacher.
meanings.sent2: She decided to realter the recipe by adding more spices.
meanings.sent3: The realter of the play made the ending even more surprising.
meanings.sent4: His decision to realter his route led him to discover a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to realter the painting to capture the right mood.

meanings.definition: A person who alters or changes something again
meanings.sent1: The realter was known for his attention to detail in every project.
meanings.sent2: She hired a realter to help redesign her living room.
meanings.sent3: The realter's creativity knew no bounds when it came to renovations.
meanings.sent4: He was a realter of old traditions, always finding new ways to improve them.
meanings.sent5: The realter's expertise was sought after by many seeking innovative solutions.
